comment: Arash is an awesome professor. He provides tools and feedback on how to improve. He gives encouragement to be bold and think out of the box.

This is for his Computational Methods class. Professor Soleimani has been, in my short experience with him, one of my favorite professors to work with. He is always enthusiastic about architecture and has inspired me to do more with computational design. Though the readings were a little lengthy, they were helpful and key to understanding material.

Prof Soleimani is a very cool guy. He's very knowledgeable in the material. The tests were not bad as long as you were in class and took notes on slides (he provides them). The lectures can be very long though. He has extra credit questions in class to help your grade. There are 2 major group projects you will complete. Overall, not too difficult.

Professor Soleimani is straightforward when lecturing and a bit strict when students don't do as told, but he is nice. He is very knowledgeable and shares as much as he can with his students. It will not be easy but if you put in the effort he will help you.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Soleimani is great for this course. From the beginning he tells you what he expects. There are 2 tests based on the lectures. He gives a pretest each time. The group projects are weighted more than the tests so put more effort in those (these projects are extensive). Have a car because of in-class field trips. Class typically ends an hour early.

Professor Soleimani is without a doubt one of the best studio professors I've had. He is committed to helping his students improve in their architectural skills. He puts a lot of  emphasis on detail and expects his students to deliver good quality work.  If your willing to  put in the time and dedication then the results will naturally show.

Professor arash soleimani is one of my top favorite professors of all time .  He will make you work like no other professor, but the end results of your project are amazing. His passion for architecture is so visible and his talent to teach is so admirable . If you want to be come better at  your craft . Take him
